comments:

2) Trying to share a java project using this repository using Team->Share
3) Select the repository, click Next
4) Select Use specified module name, click Next

Running latest Callisto 3.2 version.

I've found that the project had previously been commited to a (no longer existing) local CVS repository. After removing the local CVS files, the issue has been solved.
Should the GUI resolve the problem more gracefully?

Could you provide us with some clearification? In step 4 of the original comment, you said that "Use specified module name" was selected. Did you then type in a module name? Also, in your last comment, it is not clear to me exactly what you mean. Do you mean that the module was connected to a local repository using the local connection method? I agree that we should improve the handling of this situation but we need the exact steps required to reproduce the problem.

Moving to REMIND to await your response. Pelase reopen with the requested information.

>In step 4 of the original comment, you said that "Use specified module name" was selected. Did you then type in a module name? 

Yes, correct. Tried both this and selecting from list of modules (which didn't become populated)

>Also, in your last comment, it is not clear to me exactly what you mean. Do you mean that the module was connected to a local repository using the local connection method? 

Using the EXT method but this setup didn't work. However, the project already had CVS child folders due to a previous, successful commit outside of Eclipse.

Our usual practice is to move bugs to the RESOLVED REMIND state when there is not enough information provided to address the reported issue and more information has been requested. This bug has been in the RESOLVED REMIND state for quite some time so it is being CLOSED. If you can provide the requested information or you otherwise feel that this is still an issue, please reopen the bug. If you are unable to open it due to a lack or permissions, please add a comment to the bug stating that you would like to have the request reconsidered.  I applogize for this blanket approach to bug screening but there are just to many bugs in the REMIND state for us to effectively triage them. Your help in this matter is appreciated.
